definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

lit. "Why don't they eat meat?" (said by Emperor Hui of Jin 晉惠帝|晋惠帝[Jin4 Hui4 di4] when told that his people didn't have enough rice to eat)/fig. (of people from higher class etc) to be oblivious to other people's plight

sentences.english: She fell on some meat loaf, and it penetrated her spleen.
sentences.chinese: 她踩到块肉糜糕摔了一跤，它钻进了她的脾脏。

sentences.english: Dampen hands and form meat mixture into a palm-sized patty.
sentences.chinese: 手弄湿后，将肉糜揉成巴掌大团子。

sentences.english: Bnd a pound of mince, too.
Nisin in extending the shelf life of shrimp mince was studied.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了乳酸链球菌素对虾肉糜保鲜的作用效果。

sentences.english: In a two year period he struck out 699 batters .
sentences.chinese: 在为期两年的时间里，他打了699肉糜。

sentences.english: Stir together breadcrumbs and milk and add to meat mixture.
sentences.chinese: 面包糠和牛奶混合后也加入肉糜。

sentences.english: Because we need the pan for the minced meat.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们需要潘为肉糜。

sentences.english: Then I distribute the minced meat fairly even around.
sentences.chinese: 那么，我派发肉糜相当，甚至左右。
